info.title: Expense Tracker Project
info.description: Another expense tracker API built as a project for a bootcamp

description.description: A pithy description of this category

icon.description: An icon that can be used to quiclly identify this categroy in a front-end client

parent_category.description: The ID of the parent category, if applicable

public.description: Whether this category can be used by other members of the platform or is private. Even if set to public, a category can only be edited or deleted by its owner

items.description: A matching pattern for when importing from external sources, eg, if this category is restaurant, a possible match would be "McDowell's "

patterns.description: An array of patterns which will match this category

_id.description: The automatically generated ID of this category

createdAt.description: The date and time at which this entry was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time at which this entry was last updated

oneOf.description: The ID of the parent category, returned by default
The default category that expenses from this payee will be given when they are added

you can not access this data, check your token or whatever

parameters.name: include_parents
parameters.description: If you want to expand parent categories, call with `include_parents` set to `true`, by default the `parent_category` field will just include the category ID

items.description: The default category that expenses from this payee will be given when they are added

value.message: you do not have the authority
you can not access this data, check your token or whatever

description.description: A brief description or note about the expense.

amount.description: The cost or amount of money spent on the expense.

category.description: The category  ID of expense (e.g., groceries, utilities, transportation)

date.description: The date when the expense occurred.

payment_method.description: The method of payment used for the expense (e.g., cash, credit card, online transfer).

receipt_url.description: An attachment or link to the receipt or invoice for the expense.

expense_type.description: Type of expense (e.g., one-time, recurring, reimbursable).

notes.description: Additional notes or comments related to the expense.

tags.description: Optional tags or labels for organizing and filtering expenses (e.g., personal, business).

source_id.description: The source used for this transaction, a source generally indicates an account or wallet, for example, your bank account, a particular credit card or your benjamins

example.description: Vero esse natus minus perferendis. Fuga aspernatur explicabo dignissimos eius odit totam dolorum. Asperiores dolore vero quia magnam aut quisquam. Nam quis officiis quis perspiciatis quis veritatis atque officiis blanditiis. Sed quos ex voluptates enim sapiente doloribus ipsum repellendus dolorum.

get.description: Gets all publicly available payees as well as private payees added by the user when calling the API with a valid authentication token

field.description: The field that this pattern is compatible with. Defaults to the name field

pattern.description: The pattern used to match expenses with this payee

items.description: A field and pattern combination that can be used for automatically assigning expenses to this payee

patterns.description: An array of patterns that can be used to match expense to this payee

default_category.description: The default category that expenses from this payee will be given when they are added

icon.description: An icon that can be used to quiclly identify this categroy in a front-end client

public.description: Whether this payee can be shared among the community or is private. Defaults to `false`

created_by_user_id.description: The user ID of the user who created this Payee. A payee can only be updated or deleted by the user who created it

get.summary: Get an expense source by ID
get.description: An expense source such as a bank or credit statement from a particular financial institution

type.description: The type of expense source, for example, bank statement or invoice

format.description: The format of this source, for example, a list of comma separeted values or a markdown file

icon.description: An icon that can be used to quiclly identify this categroy in a front-end client

public.description: Indicates whether this source can be used by other users or is set to

unique_field.description: The name of the field that can be used to uniquely identify an income or expense item so that we do not end up with duplicates

date.description: The field to map to the expense date

description.description: The field to map to the expense description

notes.description: The field to map to the expense notes

amount.description: The field to map to the expense amount

mapping.description: Provide a mapping of columns to fields so that data can be imported correctly

number_style.description: Indicates whether "euro style" numbering is used, for example "1.234,56"

date_format.description: A pattern that indicates how the date is formatted, eg. for dates given as "28/02/24", your patterm would be "dd/mm/yy", for "02/28/2024", your patterm would be "mm/dd/yyyy"

source_id.description: The automatically generated ID of this source

createdAt.description: The time and date at which this entry was created

updatedAt.description: The time and date at which this entry was last udpated

created_by_user.description: The user ID of the user who created this source. A source can only be edited or deleted by the user who created it

post.description: Sign up as a new user by providing a username and password and some other optional information about yourself

userName.description: The username you would like to use on the service

password.description: The password you would like to use to access the service, must contain at least one uppercase, one lowercase letter, one number and one special character

emailAddress.description: The email address you would like to use with the service. We will send an enail to verify your  identity when you first sign up but will not spam you or pass your email address on to stalkers or spammers

user_id.description: The automatically generated ID for this user

userName.description: The username you would like to use on the service

emailAddress.description: The email address you would like to use with the service. We will send an enail to verify your  identity when you first sign up but will not spam you or pass your email address on to stalkers or spammers

fullName.description: The full name of the user. For use in a frontend client.

createdAt.description: A timestamp of the last time this entry was edited

updatedAt.description: A timestamp of when this entry was first created

post.description: Get a JWT to access the system. Tokens are generally issued with a ttl of six hours. Once you have a token, you must supply it using the `Authorization` header and specifiy that you are using the `Bearer` authorization scheme.

userName.description: The username you would like to use on the service

password.description: The password you would like to use to access the service, must contain at least one uppercase, one lowercase letter, one number and one special character

message.description: A message indicating success or failure

access_token.description: A JWT that you can use to access the service for a set amount of time before needing to reauthenticate

refresh_token.description: A JWT that you can swap for new access tokens as long as it is valid. This saves you from haivn to log in with your username and password

description.description: A brief description or note about the expense.

amount.description: The cost or amount of money spent on the expense.

category.description: The category  ID of expense (e.g., groceries, utilities, transportation)

date.description: The date when the expense occurred.

payment_method.description: The method of payment used for the expense (e.g., cash, credit card, online transfer).

receipt_url.description: An attachment or link to the receipt or invoice for the expense.

expense_type.description: Type of expense (e.g., one-time, recurring, reimbursable).

notes.description: Additional notes or comments related to the expense.

tags.description: Optional tags or labels for organizing and filtering expenses (e.g., personal, business).

source_id.description: The source used for this transaction, a source generally indicates an account or wallet, for example, your bank account, a particular credit card or your benjamins

field.description: The field that this pattern is compatible with. Defaults to the name field

pattern.description: The pattern used to match expenses with this payee

items.description: A field and pattern combination that can be used for automatically assigning expenses to this payee

patterns.description: An array of patterns that can be used to match expense to this payee

default_category.description: The default category that expenses from this payee will be given when they are added

icon.description: An icon that can be used to quiclly identify this categroy in a front-end client

public.description: Whether this payee can be shared among the community or is private. Defaults to `false`

created_by_user_id.description: The user ID of the user who created this Payee. A payee can only be updated or deleted by the user who created it

type.description: The type of this icon. Either a base 64 encoded image or a link to a hosted image

url.description: A url where the image can be found. Should be https. Unsecure images will not be accepted. The image should not exceed 30kb. Required if type is `link`

data.description: An image provided as a base64-encoded string. Your source image should not exceed 30kb. Required if type is `base64`

type.description: The type of expense source, for example, bank statement or invoice

format.description: The format of this source, for example, a list of comma separeted values or a markdown file

public.description: Indicates whether this source can be used by other users or is set to

unique_field.description: The name of the field that can be used to uniquely identify an income or expense item so that we do not end up with duplicates

date.description: The field to map to the expense date

description.description: The field to map to the expense description

notes.description: The field to map to the expense notes

amount.description: The field to map to the expense amount

mapping.description: Provide a mapping of columns to fields so that data can be imported correctly

number_style.description: Indicates whether "euro style" numbering is used, for example "1.234,56"

date_format.description: A pattern that indicates how the date is formatted, eg. for dates given as "28/02/24", your patterm would be "dd/mm/yy", for "02/28/2024", your patterm would be "mm/dd/yyyy"
